Simone:
 
 It is good of you to post Swedenborg's theology. I'm sure it gives you strength and clear seeing in your Bible readings. Truth is not truth without kindness of heart or a good heart. :) 
 
 Swedenborg talks of the Universal principles of all religion consisting of (1) belief in God and (2) living a good life.
 
 "Every man [or woman] can be saved, and those are saved who acknowledge God and live rightly" (Divine Providence n. 325). 
 
 
 Here is another quote about how people universally think of God:
 
 "This only One and very Self is omnipresent, omniscient and omnipotent. This also every Christian acknowledges from his doctrine and every gentile from his religion. In consequence, wherever he is, a man thinks that God is there and that he prays to God at hand; thinking and praying so, men cannot but think that God is everywhere, that is, omnipresent [in all places at all times]; likewise omniscient [all knowing] and omnipotent [all powerful]. Everyone praying to God, therefore, implores Him from the heart to lead him because He can lead him; thus he acknowledges the divine omnipresence, omniscience and omnipotence, doing so in turning his face to the Lord; thereupon the truth flows in from the Lord" (Divine Providence n. 157). 
 
 
 Swedenborg condensed his entire doctrine as this:
 
 "That God is one, and that there is a conjunction of charity and faith" (Soul and Body n. 20). 
 
 The condensed doctrine is that God is one, and God is a marriage of Divine Love and Divine Wisdom (which explains the union of charity and faith in saved people) and it explains the trinity too - two things that produce a resultant action. Charity, Faith and Good Works in not an outdated idea. That is what a saved person has. It is much like the Lord having the Father, Son and what comes forth from the Lord - the Holy Spirit. :)
